intro: Phymatodes yakuinsularis, commonly known as the Yaku Island phymatode, is a species of flowering plant native to the Yaku Islands in Japan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
